So this is more then just an uploading question, I plan to release my finished game on the 24th of december, 2012.
This has been in development for ~9 months and has had a lot of work put into it, including a soundtrack, sound effects, art, and a lot more.

My question is the legal rights to money that I make from this game.
My plan is to host the completed game on this site, while offering for free the downloadable client version bundled with the quest software to run it, and to have a $10 disk-and-box copy that will most likely be sold to a handful of people locally.

I guess this is directed at Alex more then anyone else, but could anyone point me to the information I need to proceed?

Thanks in advance.

Posts.EditableText: Quest's licence (see http://quest.codeplex.com/license) allows you to distribute it freely - you can even charge money if you want. And any games you create with Quest are completely under your copyright, so you can do whatever you like with them. So the short answer is yes, this is absolutely fine.
